column4: hi,  how can i set up my ubuntu box so that other machines on my network can ssh to it?
just install the pacakge openssh-server
you set that when you installed it
i wasn't the one who installed it, unfortunately
then ask the person who did
the person who installed it doesn't know
can we stop with the bot commands please ?
please stop now. using ! infront of the word is triggering the bot
find /foo -name bar -print
i tried your command, it's not working for me.  would running find -wholename /contrib -name gumstix -print work better?
no
I've given you the correct command
i tried running your command, and it found nothing
then it's not there
i tried it on a folder that is very much there, and it didn't show up
what is the name of the folder
they are called foo and bar - i made folders to test out the commands.  would it be a problem if the folder called foo wasn't in the same directory as the directory in which i ran the command?
then you are using it wrong, it works fine
if foo is in the dir bar, "find bar/ -name foo -print"
i created a series of folders, so that the structure is like so:  test/foo/bar, and i ran "~$find /foo -name bar -print" and it is not finding those folders
we are already in #ubuntu, why would you message us
wow, these spammers are good
